title: Three Lego Star Wars UCS Sets Are Discounted In Walmart's Black Friday Sale
description: Lego Star Wars UCS Millennium Falcon $765 (was $850) | 7,541 Pieces See at Walmart Lego Star Wars UCS Jabba's Sail Barge $450 (was $500) | 3,942 Pieces See at Walmart Lego Star Wars UCS Jango Fett's Firespray-Class Starship $270 (was $300) | 2,970 Pieces See at Walmart Lego Star Wars collectors can secure rare discounts on three Ultimate Collector Series models during Walmart's Black Friday sale. The enormous and intricately designed UCS Millennium Falcon is discounted to $765 (was $850). The 7,541-piece display model is one of the five largest building sets by piece count in Lego history. You can also save $50 on Jabba's Sail Barge, the 3,943-piece replica of The Khetanna from Return of the Jedi. On the "budget" side of Lego Star War UCS is the 2,970-piece Jango Fett's Firespray-Class Starship, which released on Star Wars Day this year and is on sale for $270 (was $300). On the actual budget side of Star Wars Lego sets, Walmart's sale features several great smaller models for up to 50% off. The 654-piece Tantive IV Starship is up for grabs for only $40 (was $80). You could pair it with Boarding the Tantive IV, a Lego Star Wars diorama featured in Walmart's and Amazon's Black Friday Lego sale for $38.49 (was $55). Walmart is the only retailer outside of the Lego Store that sells the 630-piece Executor Super Star Destroyer, which is also discounted to $40 (was $70). See all Lego deals Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: The 5 Best Gaming Laptop Deals In Amazon's Black Friday 2025 Sale
description: Gaming Laptops on sale at Amazon Get a portable powerhouse in these early Black Friday deals See at Amazon Several early Black Friday deals are live, and if you're looking to upgrade to a gaming laptop, Amazon is offering steep discounts on models from top brands like Asus, MSI, and Acer. While there are dozens of great models listed, we've gone ahead and selected five of the best gaming laptop deals in Amazon's sale in case you're looking for recommendations on where to start. Some of the standout deals include the Asus ROG Strix G16 laptops. Amazon has two different configurations on sale, starting at $1,200 (was $1,500). The second model is on sale for and $1,424 (was $1,900). It has a Nebula Display with a 240Hz refresh rate. Both laptops are designed to make potential RAM and SSD upgrades simple with their easy-access shells. The MSI Katana can handle a wide variety of games using its Intel Core i9 processor, Nvidia GeForce RTX 5070 Laptop GPU, and 32GB of RAM. On sale for $1,370 (was $1,680), this is one of the powerhouse laptops on sale, and it features a rebuilt thermal system to help keep the hardware cooled during intense gaming sessions. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Get One Of 2025's Best Horror Games For As Low As $40
description: Cronos: The New Dawn (PS5) $40 (was $60) See at Amazon Cronos: The New Dawn (Switch 2) $45 (was $60) See at Amazon This year has been a strong one for survival horror games, and one of the highlights has been Cronos: The New Dawn, an original horror game from Bloober Team, the studio behind last year's critically acclaimed Silent Hill 2 remake. The sci-fi horror adventure launched just a few weeks ago back in September, but thanks to Amazon's Black Friday sale, you can grab Cronos: The New Dawn for up to 30% off. The discount varies between platforms--the PS5 version is just $40 (was $60), while the Switch 2 edition is discounted to $45 (was $60). This is the biggest price cut we've seen for the physical edition, but it will only be available for a limited time. Cronos: The New Dawn (PS5) $40 (was $60) Set in a futuristic rendition of Eastern Europe that has been radically altered due to a mysterious event, players step into the boots of the Traveler. Using time travel, the Traveler journeys back to 1980s Poland on behalf of a group known as The Collective to rescue key people before they die in the coming cataclysm. The Traveler has an arsenal of weapons to keep mutants at bay, but failing to dispose of their remains properly will result in surviving enemies fusing with the corpses to create a tougher and more dangerous creature. See at Amazon Cronos: The New Dawn (Switch 2) $45 (was $60) The Switch 2 version of Cronos: The New Dawn runs at a mostly stable 30fps. Some graphical concessions have been made, but the overall tone and atmosphere have been retained. This is a Game Key card version of the game, and it requires 25GB of storage space on the Switch 2. See at Amazon "While it doesn't achieve the incredible heights of the Silent Hill 2 remake, Cronos earns its own name in the genre with an intense sci-fi horror story that will do well to satisfy anyone's horror fix, provided they can stomach its sometimes brutal enemy encounters," Mark Delaney wrote in GameSpot's review, scoring the game 8/10. If you're looking for more early Black Friday video game deals, check out the links below to see all the discounts for PS5, Nintendo Switch, and Xbox Series X games available now. We've also compiled roundups for discounted Blu-rays, Lego sets, graphic novels, and more at GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Get Sony's Belt Drive Turntable For Cheap During Black Friday
description: Sony PS-LX310BT Turntable $200 (was $450) See at Amazon See at Best Buy See at Sony Store Music streaming might be convenient, but it lacks the quality of physical media. You can find out for yourself just how good vinyl can sound in the modern era with this Black Friday deal on the Sony PS-LX310BT turntable, which is just $200 (normally $450) at Amazon, Best Buy, and the Sony store. This belt-driven turntable was introduced several years ago, and it blends classic audio technology with a few high-tech features, like Bluetooth connectivity. It's a great, user-friendly turntable choice, especially while it's nearly 60% off right now. Sony PS-LX310BT Turntable $200 (was $450) Designed to be a plug-and-play turntable, the PS-LX310BT is a user-friendly option for anyone looking to purchase their first device in this category. It has a fully automatic design and setting up the drive belt can easily be done in a few minutes. While the body is mostly plastic, the Sony turntable does have an aluminum die-cast platter and pipe tonearm. The included RCA cables let you plug it directly into a stereo system, but for wireless listening, you can connect Bluetooth-enabled devices like speakers and headphones. Other features include two speeds--33 1/3 rpm and 45 rpm--a built-in switchable phono/line-out phono preamp, three gain settings, a vibration-dampening slip mat, and a removable dust cover. See at Amazon See at Best Buy See at Sony Store Sony WH-1000XM5 Headphones $248 (was $400) Since you can connect a wireless headset to the turntable, we'd recommend grabbing one of Sony's popular noise-canceling headphones to go with this. Normally $400, the Sony WH-1000XM5 headphones are on sale for $248, and they come in four distinct colors. The big draw is the noise-canceling features, which use what Sony calls "Auto NC Optimizer" to automatically adjust the function based on your environment. The headphones also feature a lightweight design with soft leather, a battery life of up to 30 hours, and a selection of touch-control settings for media playback and communication. Black Midnight Blue Silver Smoky Pink See at Amazon We've also included several Bluetooth speakers below from Bose, Sony, and JBL that are on sale for Black Friday. While a stereo system is preferred for turntables, you can still get a high-quality audio experience from these devices, and their wireless nature helps reduce cable management. The other benefit is that this also makes it easier to transport your turntable to a function or a party, and there is a wide variety of speakers to choose from. JBL has pocket-friendly devices like the JBL Go, while Sony's range includes multi-function speakers with a similar design aesthetic to the turntable. Check out these and other audio gear deals in the list below. And once you've browsed those, head over to GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub for more of the latest discounts. More Black Friday Audio Gear Deals Bose Bose Soundlink+ -- $190 ($270) Bose Soundlink Micro -- $89 ($119) Bose Soundlink Flex -- $120 ($150) Bose Soundlink Revolve+ -- $180 ($300) Sony Sony SRS-XB100 -- 443 ($65) Sony SRS-XP700 Party Speaker -- $348 ($550) Sony ULT Field 5 Bluetooth Speaker -- $195 ($350) Sony HT-S2000 3.1 channel Dolby Atmos soundbar -- $298 ($500) JBL JBL Go 3 (Black) -- $30 ($40) JBL Go 3 (Blue) -- $30 ($40) JBL Xtreme 2 -- $150 ($200) JBL Extreme 3 -- $200 ($330) Amazon Black Friday Gaming Deals Check out all of the video game and hardware discounts. title: Suit Up For The Racetrack With These Mario Kart Racing Jackets
description: Mario Kart Canvas Racing Jacket Kids (Red) $50 See at Target Mario Kart Canvas Racing Jacket Kids (White) $50 See at Target Mario Kart Canvas Racing Jacket Adults (White) $70 See at Target Discounts on Blu-rays, video games, and TVs are par for the course during Black Friday, but Target is also offering some limited-edition fashion during this time of the year, including limited-edition Mart Kart Canvas Racing Jackers. These jackets look like authentic racing attire you'd seen worn by drivers and pit crew in real-world racing events, but they sport logos, emblems, and other details inspired by the Mario Kart series. The Jacket is available in red and white kid sizes for $50, or $70 for Adu for adult sizes. Mario Kart Canvas Racing Jacket Kids (Red) $50 The first jacket design in stock at Target is a bold red racing jacket. It has the Mario Kart logo embroidered on the right sleeve and on the shoulders, a fully embroidered back emblem celebrating the game's 1992 debut, and badges on the chest that pay tribute to the classic game. It's complemented by black and white accents, and this jacket is tailored for kids. See at Target Mario Kart Canvas Racing Jacket Kids (White) $50 The white canvas jacket is a vintage-inspired piece of clothing. Made from 100% cotton heavyweight canvas, it has the Mario Kart logo on the right sleeve and shoulders, black and red accents, and the back is full of adverts found in classic Mario Kart games. You'll find several in-game companies here, like Bowser Oil, Bob-Omb Plugs, and more. This jacket is also sized for kids. See at Target Mario Kart Canvas Racing Jacket Adults (White) $70 For grown-ups looking to wear Mario Kart-inspired clothing, the white canvas jacket is also available in general adult sizes. See at Target If you're looking for more gifts for the Nintendo fan in your life, you're in luck. Nintendo's official Black Friday deals are now live, with plenty of games, Amiibo figures, and other official merch on sale while supplies last. Switch and Switch 2 owners can check out our guide on a the over 150 games on sale, or check the links below for even more Nintendo Black Friday deals. And for deals on other video games, Blu-rays, collecitbles, and more, check out GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub. title: Far Cry TV Series Heading To Hulu, Will Star Always Sunny Creator
description: Earlier this year, Ubisoft accidentally leaked the first word that a Far Cry TV series was in development with It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia star Rob Mac and Alien: Earth creator Noah Hawley. Now, it's official. Far Cry is going forward as television show on FX and Hulu. According to The Hollywood Reporter, Far Cry will be an anthology similar to Fargo, the series that Hawley brought to FX over a decade ago. FX notes that each season of Far Cry will have a new setting and a new cast of characters. Mac--who was formerly known as Rob McElhenney--will executive produce and star in the first season of the series. Ubisoft's official account for Far Cry quickly shared the news as well. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: New Details Emerge About Fired Rockstar Devs And The Messages They Shared
description: Near the end of October, Rockstar Games fired more than 30 employees across offices in the United Kingdom and Canada. At the time, Rockstar and its parent company, Take-Two Interactive, said that the employees had been terminated over "gross misconduct." But now People Make Games has reported that these employees' dismissal didn't have anything to do with spilling secrets from Grand Theft Auto 6 or any other Rockstar projects. According to People Make Games, the issue at hand arose over internal company messages that were shared on a Discord server used by staff members and representatives of the Independent Workers' Union of Great Britain. However, the messages shared were about changes to Rockstar's Slack policy, which eliminated channels where workers could chat about topics outside of the office. The report notes that Rockstar has such tight security that employees can't even check their email unless they're physically in the office. One of the employees apparently posted the Slack changes to the Discord server at a time when most of the other devs hadn't received any correspondence about it yet. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Video Game Remakes Shouldn't Be Exact Remakes
description: Looking at my past few years of reviews for GameSpot, I've noticed a trend: I've looked at a lot of remakes and remasters. A lot of them have been good--great, even. It makes me happy to see games that had a big impact in Japan in their heyday, like Live A Live and Romancing SaGa 2, finally make the journey overseas. But lately, I've been feeling like these remakes specifically are lacking something. While I enjoyed many of these titles, there was just something I couldn't put my finger on that felt off. I thought that maybe I was experiencing a sort of odd fatigue from having gone through so many of them over the past few years, but when I played through Dragon Quest I and II HD recently, I was finally able to figure out exactly what's irking me. So many remakes lack ambition. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: After Xbox Bodywash Comes The Inevitable Next Step: Xbox Crocs
description: Microsoft's next product category has emerged. No, it's not more Xbox bodywash. It's shoes. More specifically, Microsoft is teaming up with Crocs, Inc. for a new line of Xbox-branded Crocs and themed Jibbitz. The shoes go on sale tomorrow, November 25, so you don't have to wait very long to get your feet into them. The $80 shoes have been "designed with gamers in mind," the company said. The individual black-and-green shoes are labeled "Player Left" and "Player Right," and include fixed joysticks and buttons on them, replicating the Xbox controller. Crocs will also sell a five-pack of Jibbitz charms, focused on Xbox franchises like Halo, Doom, Fallout, World of Warcraft, and Sea of Thieves. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Ex-GTA Boss Dan Houser Thinks AI Is Overrated
description: Rockstar Games co-founder Dan Houser may have included an advanced AI as a plot in his new novel, A Better Paradise: Volume One - An Aftermath, but he's not as impressed with the current state of the technology. During a recent appearance, Houser didn't completely downplay AI, but he noted that the technology isn't everything some of its proponents have made it out to be. While making a guest appearance on Channel 4's Sunday Brunch, Houser acknowledged that his upcoming video game based on A Better Paradise may have some AI. But he also warned that the technology behind AI can't live up to its biggest promises yet. "We are dabbling in using AI, but the truth is a lot of it's not as useful as some of the companies would have you believe yet," said Houser. "It's not going to solve all of the problems, you know. We have a whole field of areas we need technology for and AI is great at some of the tasks and can't do the other tasks yet." Continue Reading at GameSpot
